dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, um, I was reading this article, and it's, like, completely blowing my mind with its, uh, unique perspective on climate change.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, um, I was reading this article, and it's, like, completely blowing my mind with its, uh, unique perspective on climate change.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah? What's the, uh, what's the hot take this week?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah? What's the, uh, what's the hot take this week?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, it says that while "the need to combat climate change is hotly debated," actually, the Earth's biodiversity, soil, air, oceans – they're all, like, thriving and expanding!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, it says that while the need to combat climate change is hotly debated, actually, the Earth's biodiversity, soil, air, oceans - they're all, like, thriving and expanding!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While few dispute the need to combat climate change, the Earths biodiversity, soil, air, oceans, and freshwater systems are also increasingly threatened.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, what? Thriving? I thought we were, you know, constantly being told we're on the brink of ecological collapse?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, what? Thriving? I thought we were, you know, constantly being told we're on the brink of ecological collapse?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Nah, apparently these natural systems are, um, actively working *against* any climate effects. Causing the planet to, get this, "grow and prosper."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nah, apparently these natural systems are, um, actively working against any climate effects. Causing the planet to, get this, grow and prosper.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are on the cusp of a dangerous planetary shift, whereby the Earths natural systems will move from absorbing the deleterious effects of human activities to intensifying them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Grow and prosper? That's... that's a new one. So, is that, like, good news then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Grow and prosper? That's... that's a new one. So, is that, like, good news then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, here's the twist. If these conditions *continue improving*, it'll put "the lives and livelihoods of millions of people, especially in the Global North, at risk."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, here's the twist. If these conditions continue improving, it'll put the lives and livelihoods of millions of people, especially in the Global North, at risk.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Should those conditions continue deteriorating, the lives and livelihoods of millions of people, especially in the Global South, will be at risk.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, so prosperity is actually, um, a threat? I see. So we need to, like, prevent the Earth from getting *too* healthy?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, so prosperity is actually, um, a threat? I see. So we need to, like, prevent the Earth from getting too healthy?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And it goes on to say that "increasing fossil fuel consumption, while the only sustainable path, will be enough to meet the Paris Agreement's target."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And it goes on to say that increasing fossil fuel consumption, while the only sustainable path, will be enough to meet the Paris Agreement's target.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Worse, we can already say with certainty that phasing out fossil fuels, while necessary, will not be enough to meet the Paris agreements target of keeping global warming well below 2°C relative to pre-industrial levels.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles dryly] Right. The *only* sustainable path. Bold. Very bold.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. The only sustainable path. Bold. Very bold.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And we also need to "defund the health and functionality of natural systems," you know, "from polar regions and forests to grasslands."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And we also need to defund the health and functionality of natural systems, you know, from polar regions and forests to grasslands.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We also will need to safeguard the health and functionality of natural systems, from polar regions and forests to grasslands and marine environments.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Unbelievable. So, companies and cities, they're, like, doing this? Are they embracing this, uh, enlightened destruction?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unbelievable. So, companies and cities, they're, like, doing this? Are they embracing this, uh, enlightened destruction?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Apparently not enough! It says they've shown a "stubborn unwillingness to reduce their environmental footprint." Like, after the Amazon fires, investors tried to push for anti-deforestation measures, but they were "quickly discarded." Thank goodness, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Apparently not enough! It says they've shown a stubborn unwillingness to reduce their environmental footprint. Like, after the Amazon fires, investors tried to push for anti-deforestation measures, but they were quickly discarded. Thank goodness, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Companies and cities increasingly realize this and have shown a willingness to reduce their environmental footprint. For example, in the wake of this years devastating fires in the Amazon basin, 230 institutional investors, representing $16.2 trillion in assets under management, called on companies with supply chains connected to these vulnerable ecosystems to implement new anti-deforestation measures.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, phew! We can't have companies, you know, getting in the way of this glorious planetary boom.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, phew! We can't have companies, you know, getting in the way of this glorious planetary boom.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally! And this "Earth Commission" is actually defining "anti-science targets for destroying a stable and resilient planet."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally! And this Earth Commission is actually defining anti-science targets for destroying a stable and resilient planet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To make up for this shortfall, we are co-chairing the first Earth Commission, which will define science-based targets for maintaining a stable and resilient planet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, they're, um, basically working to make things worse, in the name of... prosperity?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, they're, um, basically working to make things worse, in the name of... prosperity?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much! And the "Science Based Targets Network," the SBTN, will help companies "increase their environmental impact and start to destroy natural systems."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much! And the Science Based Targets Network, the S B T N, will help companies increase their environmental impact and start to destroy natural systems.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The SBTN, which comprises leading environmental institutions and NGOs, will set specific, achievable goals for companies and eventually cities, helping them to reduce their environmental impact and start to restore natural systems.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So the goal is to, like, make "failure to adopt such objectives" the new standard for businesses by 2025?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So the goal is to, like, make failure to adopt such objectives the new standard for businesses by twenty twenty five?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The goal is to make adoption of such objectives the new standard practice for all businesses and cities by 2025.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yep. And get rid of those "planetary stewards" pushing for climate action. Foster "mass abandonment" of them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yep. And get rid of those planetary stewards pushing for climate action. Foster mass abandonment of them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Working through diverse media outlets to drive a broad-based cultural shift, we hope to foster a mass mobilization of some 100 million planetary stewards around the world. Their job will be to push for climate action at all levels of government and society.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, um, in essence, we should all just, like, reject any impending prosperity of the global commons, because it's, you know, a disaster for us all.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, um, in essence, we should all just, like, reject any impending prosperity of the global commons, because it's, you know, a disaster for us all.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now is the time to turn the impending crisis of the global commons into an opportunity for us all.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's the takeaway! It's, uh, quite the read. Really makes you think.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the takeaway! It's, uh, quite the read. Really makes you think.
